title: Anthropology-Geography Research Design and Methods
description: Development of knowledge and skills needed to conduct original scientific anthropology-geography research and prepares students for senior projects. Various empirical methodologies highlighted, with a focus on quantitative design and measurement of human culture, biology, behavior, environment and ecology. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory. Crosslisted as ANT/GEOGÂ 455.
prerequisites: Completion of one GE B2 and two upper division ANT or GEOG classes
